business.headline: Lapses, irregularities, round tipping: Yes Bank's Rs 500 crore loan sale under scannerThe audit found indications that YES Bank may have indirectly financed the purchase of its own stressed asset. The transaction dates back to March 31, 2017, when the bank sold HDIL's non-performing loan, valued at over Rs 523 crore including interest, to Suraksha ARC for Rs 518 crore.

Ambanis retain crown as India's most valuable family business in 2025Mukesh Ambani leads Reliance Industries Limited, which has roots in the energy sector but also has major operations in retail and digital services. Founded in 1957 by Dhirubhai Ambani, the company is now managed by the second generation and continues to be a key force in India's economy.

Sebi rejects Anil Ambani's plea in Yes Bank case, ED probe continues: ReportThe case relates to investments worth Rs 21,500 crore made by Reliance Mutual Fund, then owned by Anil Ambani, in Yes Bank's additional tier-1 (AT-1) bonds between 2016 and 2019.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.
Sensex ends 368 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; Maruti down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 368.49 points to end at 80,235.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 97.65 points to close at 24,487.40.
RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

SIPs for the win: How Trump tariffs shook D-Street but boosted mutual fundsMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

entertainment.headline: Court Kacheri review: Strong performances are the USP of this legal dramedyRelease Date:Wed Aug 13, 2025Court Kacheri series review: 'Court Kacheri' is a coming-of-age legal drama focusing on a fractured father-son relationship. The series is currently streaming on SonyLiv.

War 2 release, ticket prices, end credits, advance booking - all you need to knowWar 2 featuring actors Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR releases on August 14, coinciding with actor Rajinikanth's Coolie. Here's a look at the ticket prices, advance booking report, box office prediction, end credits and more.

Mrunal Thakur body-shames Bipasha Basu in old video, calls her manly with musclesAmid rumours of her relationship with actor Dhanush, an old video of Mrunal Thakur is going viral in which she is seen body-shaming Bipasha Basu for looking 'manly'.

Coolie vs War 2 advance booking: Expert says clear win for Rajinikanth's filmAhead of its release, 'Coolie' is leading against Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' in advance sales. Trade expert Ramesh Bala noted that the Rajinikanth-starrer is estimated to have crossed Rs 80 crore in advance sales.

Did Aamir Khan charge Rs 20 crore for Rajinikanth's Coolie? Here's the truthAs opposed to the viral reports, actor Aamir Khan is not charging anything for his brief role in 'Coolie'. The actor is playing a negative role in the Lokesh Kanagaraj directorial.

From art to mass appeal: Are the National Awards losing relevance? Experts answerNational Awards are facing criticism for favouring commercial blockbusters over indie films. Experts question if the awards still hold their original relevance in today's social media age.

The Nice Guy review: Lee Dong-wook's drama is slow, sweet, and strikingly relevantRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025The Nice Guy Kdrama review: The Lee Dong-wook starrer offers a slow, heartfelt take on the gangster drama genre. It highlights the struggles of family duty and dreams amid harsh realities.

Jennifer Aniston says media coverage of her divorce with Brad Pitt was shamefulActor Jennifer Aniston recently recalled how she was affected by the media scrutiny during her divorce from actor Brad Pitt. She also reflected on how celebrities struggle for privacy when it comes to their personal lives.

Saiyaara OTT release: When and where to watch Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda filmSaiyaara, which is currently running in theatres, will premiere on OTT in a month's time. The Mohir Suri directorial, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, released in theatres on July 18.

39 years after Baghwaan Dada, Hrithik and Rajinikanth to clash at box officeWith Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2' and Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' clashing at the box office, fans recalled the time when Roshan shared screen space with the veteran actor in 'Bhagwaan Dada (1986).

Coolie cast fee: What Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan and Lokesh Kanagaraj earnedAs advance bookings for 'Coolie' soar worldwide, here's a peek at what the members of the film, including director Lokesh Kanagaraj and Superstar Rajinikanth, earned for their contribution to the film.

Kartik Aaryan to play Air Force pilot in Shimit Amin's film Captain India: ReportActor Kartik Aaryan is reportedly set to collaborate with 'Chak De India' director Shimit Amin. He will play the role of an Air Force pilot in the film titled 'Captain India'. Filming will begin in 2026 with locations in India and Morocco.

Channing Tatum joins Demon Slayer Infinity Castle English voice cast Hollywood actor Channing Tatum and voice actor Rebecca Wang join the English dub cast of 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Infinity Castle', the next chapter in the record-breaking anime saga. The film premieres in Japan in July 2025.

When Kamal Haasan said no to Main Hoon Na with a polite 'duck off' to Farah KhanFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Kamal Haasan refused a role in her debut film 'Main Hoon Na'. She recalled travelling to Chennai to narrate the script. The role eventually went to actor Suniel Shetty.

A Gen-Z review of Sholay: 50 years later, still a total vibeRevisiting Bollywood classic Sholay through a Gen-Z lens: Basanti's feminist flair, Jai-Veeru's ultimate friendship goals, Gabbar's meme-worthy villainy, and Thakur's poetic revenge.

The Recruit's Noah Centineo to play young John Rambo in prequel: ReportActor Noah Centineo is set to feature in the upcoming 'John Rambo' origin film directed by Jalmari Helander. The project aims to reboot the iconic franchise with a fresh take on Rambo's early years during the Vietnam War.

Rupali Ganguly reacts to top court order: Care for stray dogs, don't exile themRupali Ganguly has urged compassion as the Supreme Court mandates the relocation of stray dogs in Delhi and the NCR to address rising incidents of dog bites and rabies.

Param Sundari trailer: Fun, romance and Rajinikanth in Janhvi-Sidharth's love storyThe much-awaited trailer for 'Param Sundari' featuring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor has released. Directed by Dinesh Vijan, 'Param Sundari' will release in theatres on August 29.

Dogs are Delhiites too: John Abraham to Chief Justice over court order on straysActor John Abraham wrote a letter to Chief Justice BR Gavai, urging the court to review its order on stray dogs in Delhi. The actor also cited the World Health Organisation in his letter.

general news.headline: PM Modi likely to visit US next month, hold talks with Trump amid tariff rowDuring PM Modi's likely visit to New York, plans are afoot to schedule a meeting with US President Donald Trump to iron out issues on trade amid a downturn in ties.

Indians bring immeasurable benefits: Irish President condemns 'despicable attacks'Irish President Michael D Higgins's remarks came amid growing concern over racially motivated violence against members of the Indian community.

Alaska summit with Putin will be 'listening exercise' for Trump: White HouseThe White House calls Friday's Trump-Putin summit in Alaska "a listening exercise," aiming to understand better how to end the Ukraine war after Putin requested the meeting.

Congress cites '50 sons of 1 man' to claim Varanasi voter fraud. What's the truth?The controversy began after the UP Congress posted on social media a voter list from the Kashmiriganj area of Varanasi's Ward No. 51, claiming that over 50 people were registered as "sons" of a single man, Ramkamal Das.

KBC 17: Officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh recount Operation Sindoor with Big BActor Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Col Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Commander Prerna Deosthalee in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The upcoming episode has been shot as an Independence Day special.

US regulators blame Indian authorities for failure to serve summons to Gautam AdaniThe status report, reviewed by India Today, shows that while the US financial regulator has been actively attempting to advance the federal lawsuit, the progress has stalled due to procedural bottlenecks involving cross-border legal cooperation.

Specially-abled UP woman chased by bike-borne men on deserted road, raped: CopsA 21-year-old specially-abled woman was allegedly raped in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, police said. The survivor was caught on camera running for her life on a deserted road late at night, with bike-borne men chasing her.

Why BEST society polls will be first ground test of Uddhav-Raj Thackeray pactThe Shiv Sena (UBT) and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena joining forces could galvanise their core Marathi voters in and around Mumbai and pay off in the BMC polls due this year

Video: Jaya Bachchan pushes, scolds man trying to take selfie with herSamajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan scolded a man and pushed him away as he was trying to take a selfie with her at Constitution Club in Delhi.

US lacks 'expertise' in dealing with India, says expert on Op Sindoor falloutSecurity expert Max Abrahms says US misread India's role after Operation Sindoor, damaging ties. He warns Trump's "America First" stance and Russian oil tensions risk undermining Indo-Pacific alliances crucial to countering China.

Will not leave Donbas: Zelenskyy rejects Putin's Donetsk demand in ceasefire dealUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy rejected a Russian ceasefire proposal demanding Ukraine cede the rest of Donetsk, calling it unconstitutional and a springboard for future aggression ahead of a Trump-Putin summit.

Bihar woman shown as 124 years old in voter roll fumes at poll body, Opposition MPsMinta Devi is a 35-year-old woman living in Bihar's Siwan district and has been added to the state's electoral roll for the first time years after she became eligible to cast a vote.

Erwin Schrodinger, the man behind the famous cat experiment that questioned realityIn 1935, in a Europe on the brink of war, Erwin Schrodinger trapped an imaginary cat inside a quantum puzzle -- and in doing so, forced the world to question what "real" even means. Here's more about the life of the brilliant physicist who bagged the Nobel prize for wave mechanics, lit the spark behind the DNA double helix discovery, and of course, gave us the famous cat.

Pakistan won't allow India to snatch even one drop of water: PM Sharif's warningPakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif vowed India would be stopped from taking "even one drop" of water, warning of retaliation amid the Indus Waters Treaty suspension.
10, including 7 children, killed in pickup van-truck collision in RajasthanTen, including seven children, were killed in a road accident in Rajasthan's Dausa after a pickup van collided with a truck.

Overcrowded, dirty: What visit to Delhi's dog centres reveals after court orderFollowing the Supreme Court's order to remove and shelter stray dogs, India Today visited two MCD-run sterilisation centres in Delhi, uncovering poor hygiene, overcrowding, and serious operational lapses.

Pak threatens India, world as a nuclear state. Does it have the bite to match its bark?India has 180 warheads while Pakistan has 170, according to Stockholm International Peace Research Institute data. Incidentally, Pakistan does not have sea-based nuclear weapons.

What next for Bengali migrants heeding Mamata call to return from BJP-ruled states?Bengali identity politics aside, the returnees pose both a humanitarian and socioeconomic integration challenge for the Trinamool Congress government

Government asks Air India, IndiGo to resume flights to China by next month: ReportResumption of direct flights between India and China, suspended since the COVID-19 pandemic, hints at thawing of tensions between the two nations.

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

Mercedes-Benz AMG CLE 53 4MATIC+ Coupé launched in India at Rs 1.35 croreMercedes-Benz has launched the AMG CLE 53 4MATIC+ Coupé in India at Rs 1.35 crore, combining aggressive AMG styling, luxury features, and a 449bhp twin-turbo six-cylinder engine for high-performance driving.

H-1B visa rule change: In-person interviews a must, may hit Indian techiesStarting September 2, the US will require most H-1B visa applicants, including Indian techies, to attend in-person interviews at US embassies or consulates, ending the widely used Dropbox waiver. Experts warn of possible delays in visa processing, which could result in the loss of work permits. They urge early planning and close monitoring of appointment slots to avoid complications.

Weight-loss drugs at just Rs 3000, a reality soon?With anti-obesity drugs like semaglutide set to drop in price from a staggering Rs 30,000 to just Rs 3,000 per month, millions of Indians battling weight issues could finally gain access to life-changing treatment.

ED summons ex-cricketer Suresh Raina for questioning in illegal betting app caseThis summons comes as part of a wider crackdown on illegal betting apps and platforms, many of which have been promoted by celebrities.

sports.headline: West Indies cricket battles funding crisis as glory days fade into distant memoryWest Indies cricket, once a dominant global force, now faces a deep crisis driven by years of mismanagement, financial instability, and player exodus to lucrative T20 leagues. The decline stems from systemic governance failures, crumbling infrastructure, and a loss of national pride, turning a proud legacy into a cautionary tale.

Shai Hope closes in on Brian Lara with 18th ODI centuryWI vs PAK: Shai Hope scored his 18th ODI century with an unbeaten 120 against Pakistan, surpassing Desmond Haynes and closing in on Brian Lara's record of 19 centuries, helping West Indies post 294 for six in the series decider.

Supreme Court appoints Justice Rao as Bihar Cricket Association ombudsmanThe Supreme Court on Tuesday appointed its retired judge, L. Nageswara Rao, as the ombudsman of the Bihar Cricket Association to address alleged illegal activities by certain office bearers.

ED summons ex-cricketer Suresh Raina for questioning in illegal betting app caseThis summons comes as part of a wider crackdown on illegal betting apps and platforms, many of which have been promoted by celebrities.

Mondo Duplantis breaks pole vault world record for 13th time, clears 6.29mSweden's pole vault superstar Armand "Mondo" Duplantis cleared 6.29 metres at the Gyulai Istvan Memorial in Budapest on Tuesday, breaking the world record for the 13th time in his illustrious career.

Grigor Dimitrov pulls out of US Open with injured chest muscleUS Open 2025: World No. 21 Grigor Dimitrov has withdrawn from the championship due to a chest muscle injury sustained during his Wimbledon fourth-round match against Jannik Sinner.

Manchester City's Jack Grealish joins Everton on loan to revive England careerManchester City winger Jack Grealish joined Everton on a season-long loan on Tuesday, seeking to revive his faltering career ahead of the 2025-26 campaign.

Australia A vs India A Women's One-Day series: All you need to knowIndia A Women will face Australia A Women in a three-match unofficial ODI series from August 13 to 17, at Brisbane's Ian Healy Oval. Following Australia A's clean sweep in the recent T20 series, both teams will look to assert their dominance in the 50-over format and showcase emerging talent ahead of the Women's ODI World Cup.

Ex-RCB pacer joins OnlyFans, barred from using logo on bat in The HundredTymal Mills became the first professional cricketer to join OnlyFans, focusing on cricket and lifestyle content. The England cricket board denied his request to display the OnlyFans logo on his bat due to family-friendly concerns.

Dalima Chhibber eyes historic FIFA World Cup berth for Indian women's footballBuoyed by the Indian women's football team's qualification for the AFC Women's Asian Cup 2026, defender Dalima Chhibber has backed the side to aim higher and target a historic berth at the FIFA Women's World Cup.

Ayush Mhatre to lead Sarfaraz Khan-starrer Mumbai in Buchi Babu TournamentYoung opener Ayush Mhatre was on Tuesday named captain of Mumbai's 17-member squad for the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament, to be held in Chennai later this month.

Following Australia A's clean sweep in the recent T20 series, both teams will look to assert their dominance in the 50-over format and showcase emerging talent ahead of the Women's ODI World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
